original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares down on profit taking
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares down in mid day trade on Monday, on profit taking and selling pressure over the constant gains in the previous days of trading, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.24 percent or 24.71 points to 10,277.25, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.94 percent or 28.44 points to 2,993.94
“Market is down marginally on profit taking on the banking sector,” an analyst said.
The market generated a turnover of 1.1 billion rupees at 1200 hours.

Despite the market being down, there is some slow interest on the capital goods sector due to constant assurances on the debt restructuring front, while policy rates were cut by 200 basis points, while inflation also stooped down to 12 percent and is expected to drop further to single digits in the next month.
The losers during 1200 hours were Sampath Bank, Commercial Bank and Richard Pieris and Company. (Colombo/July10/2023)
